page.title: 17History of Blackridge
page.content: The East End of{Blackridge}was called{Westrigg}between the years of 1920 and 1950. The Industry in the village was mainly{pits.}There were 2 pipe bands. They had 2 football teams. There was a thatched cottage called Tylers. They sold milk from the dairy at the side of the house. There were two co_op stores, which sold{drapery, shoes,}groceries, pots, pans and shovels. At one time there was a shop called Simpsons which made furniture. There was a{bank}and a {police station.} The{Craig Inn}farm was a stopping place for travellers in stage coaches while the drivers changed horses. The village also had a Public Hall where nearly all dances and weddings took place. The tennis courts and the bowling green were beside the miners welfare near the {Craigs Inn.
